• Practise slow, deep breathing in preparation for panic attacks; breathe in deeply through your nose and count to three, then breathe out slowly – this can calm you down if you’re scared that you’ll have a panic attack 

• Avoid resisting a panic attack – it could make your symptoms worse, instead try to focus on remembering that your life isn’t at risk and that you’ll get past the attack 

• Try to challenge your fear; you have noted down what you felt, why do you think you felt like this? Was it rational?

• Please seek help immediately: you can contact the Samaritans at 116 123, or your local Accident and Emergency department at 999 \n\n• Suicide is a permanent solution to a temporary problem, though life might be painful now, think about things you would like to see and do in the future.
